thing-type.label: SP814 Motion Detector
thing-type.description: Motion Detector<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe Motion Detector is a Z-WaveTM enabled device which is fully compatible with any Z-WaveTM enabled network. Z-WaveTM enabled devices displaying the Z-WaveTM logo can also be used with it regardless of the manufacturer, and ours can also be used in other manufacturer’s Z-WaveTM enabled networks. This Motion Detector can control our modules via controller setting. Inclusion of this Motion Detector on other manufacturer’s Wireless Controller menu allows remote turn-on of connected modules when the detector is triggered. </p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtPressing link key 3 times within 1.5 second will enter inclusion mode.</p&gt <p&gtThe Detector will stay “awake” for 10 minutes to allow time for setting and device status enquiring.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtPressing link key 3 times within 1.5 second will enter exclusion mode.</p&gt <p&gtThe Detector will stay “awake” for 10 minutes to allow time for setting and device status enquiring. </p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtNot Provided</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Basic Set Level
parameter.description: Basic Set Level<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtWhen Basic Set Command is sent where contains a value, the receiver will take it for consideration; for instance, if a lamp module is received the Basic Set command of which value is decisive as to how bright of dim level of lamp module shall be.</p&gt <p&gtExample: 0: OFF</p&gt <p&gt1-99: ON (Binary Switch Device)</p&gt <p&gtDim Level (Multilevel Switch Device)</p&gt <p&gtFunction: Basic Set level</p&gt <p&gtParameter: 1</p&gt <p&gtNumber Size: 1</p&gt <p&gtRange: 0-99</p&gt <p&gtDefault: 99 </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Enable/Disable Detecting
parameter.description: The Detecting function can be Disabled or Enabled.

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Sensitivity Level
parameter.description: 1 Means lowest sensitivity and 10 means highest.

parameter.name: config_4_2
parameter.label: 4: Re-trigger Interval
parameter.description: Adjust the interval of being re-triggered after a trigger<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe Configuration parameter that can be used to adjust the interval of being re-triggered after the detector has been triggered as Configuration Parameter #4. No response will be made during this interval if a movement is presented. The time interval can be set between 5 secs to 3600 secs. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Lux Level
parameter.description: Minimum Lux Level to provoke trigger<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets minimum Lux Level of ambient illumination necessary for Motion Detector to trigger.</p&gt <p&gtThe user can set a detecting percentage of lux level which determines when the light sensor will be activated. If percentage of lux level of ambient illumination falls below this percentage, and a person moves across or within the protected area, the detector will emit Z-Wave ON Command (i.e. Basic Set Command (Value = Basic Set Level)) to controller and activate connected modules and lighting. Percentage can be set between 1% to 100%.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_1
parameter.label: 6: On-Off Duration
parameter.description: On-Off Duration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe function of on-off duration setting will be useful if the detector is connected with a module or lighting. The duration determines how long the module/lighting should stay ON. For instance, Lamp Module turns off 100 secs after it has been turned on. This parameter can be configured with the value of 5 through 3600, where 5 means 5 second delay and 3600 means 3600 seconds of delay</p&gt</p&gt
